question: Sweet Shop Management Scenario: You are managing a sweet shop inventory. Perform the following: 1. Create an ArrayList named sweets. 2. Add at least 6 sweet names. 3. Print the complete list. 4. Print the collection size. 5. Retrieve and print: First sweet, Last sweet, Sweet at 3rd position.
sampleInput: [Gulab Jamun, Laddu, Kaju Katli, Laddu, Rasgulla, Jalebi]
sampleOutput:
Sweet List: [Gulab Jamun, Laddu, Kaju Katli, Laddu, Rasgulla, Jalebi]
Total Sweets: 6
First Sweet: Gulab Jamun
Last Sweet: Jalebi
Sweet at 3rd Position: Kaju Katli
description: Manage sweets list and access elements

question: Company List Scenario: You are maintaining a list of IT companies. Perform the following: 1. Create ArrayList companies. 2. Add at least 5 company names. 3. Print all companies using normal for loop and enhanced for-each loop.
sampleInput: [Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Oracle, IBM]
sampleOutput:
Companies (Normal For Loop):
Google
Microsoft
Amazon
Apple
Facebook
Oracle
IBM

Companies (Enhanced For-Each Loop):
Google
Microsoft
Amazon
Apple
Facebook
Oracle
IBM
description: Manage companies list and access elements

question: Product List - CRUD Operations Scenario: Electronic product inventory management. Perform operations: add, print, count, read first/last, for-loop, for-each-loop, indexOf, lastIndexOf, contains, update, remove, isEmpty, clear.
sampleOutput:
Initial Product List: [Laptop, Speaker, Mouse, Keyboard, Monitor]
Total Products: 5
First Product: Laptop
Last Product: Monitor

Products using for-loop:
Laptop
Speaker
Mouse
Keyboard
Monitor

Products using for-each loop:
Laptop
Speaker
Mouse
Keyboard
Monitor

Index of 'Mouse': 2
Last index of 'Laptop': 5
Contains 'Keyboard'? true
After updating Monitor: [Laptop, Speaker, Mouse, Keyboard, LED Monitor, Laptop]
After removals: [Speaker, Keyboard, LED Monitor, Laptop]
Is Product List empty? false
After clearing: []
description: Manage products list and perform CRUD operations

{102, Chicken Curry, 250, NonVeg, 15},
